content.raw:
Thank you!

I noticed that the `_retrieve_refs` in `__init__` kwargs is only respected in `next` calls and not in custom `iterfind` calls, so I guess we need to save it as an instance attribute in `__init__` and rely on it in `iterfind`, too. I didn’t want to inflate this PR, as you noted it was getting broader than you wanted, so I’ll add this myself if there are no objections.

Also we passed the 1000-th commit to pyteomics somewhere along the way, so congratulations and thanks again for all your contributions.
content.html:
Thank you!

I noticed that the _retrieve_refs in __init__ kwargs is only respected in next calls and not in custom iterfind calls, so I guess we need to save it as an instance attribute in __init__ and rely on it in iterfind, too. I didn’t want to inflate this PR, as you noted it was getting broader than you wanted, so I’ll add this myself if there are no objections.

Also we passed the 1000-th commit to pyteomics somewhere along the way, so congratulations and thanks again for all your contributions.
